verses.verse: And it happened when Jesus finished these messages; He took off out of Galilee and went to the borders of Judea on the other side of the Jordan River.
And big crowds followed Him, and He healed them there.
And the Separatists came to Him trying to cause Him trouble and saying to Him, "Tell us if a person is permitted to dismiss his wife regarding every accusation."
When Jesus answered, He said to them, "Didn't you read that the One who made them, from the beginning made them male and female
and said, (in Genesis 2:24) 'On account of this, a person will leave the father and the mother down there, be stuck like glue to his wife, and the two will be in one physical body'?
In such a way, they are no longer two, but one physical body. So a thing that God strapped together, a person must not separate.
They say to Him, "So why did Moses demand to give a scroll of divorce and to dismiss her?"
He says to them, "Moses for your hardheartedness gave you permission to dismiss your wives, but from the beginning it has not happened like that.
But I tell you that whoever dismisses his wife, except it is based on sexual sin, and marries another is cheating on his wife. And the one who marries a wife who has been dismissed is cheating."
His students say to Him, "If this is how the accusation of the person with the wife is, it is not advantageous to marry."
Jesus said to them, "Not everyone makes room for this message, but it is for the people to whom it has been given.

You see, there are castrated men, some who were born like this from their mother's belly, there are castrated men, some who were castrated by the people, and there are castrated men, some who castrated themselves because of the empire of the heavens. The person who is able to be making room must make room.
At that time, young children were brought to Him so that He might place His hands on them and pray. But the students forbid them.
But Jesus said, "Leave the young children, and don't hinder them to come to Me. You see, the empire of the heavens is made up of these types of children."
And after He placed His hands on them, He traveled from there.
And look, when one person came to Him, he said, "Good Teacher, what good thing should I do so that I may have life that spans all time?"
Jesus said to him, "Why do you call Me good? No one is good except one, God. But if you want to go into the life, keep the demands."
He says to Him, "Which ones?" Jesus said, "The 'you will not murder, you will not cheat on your spouse, you will not steal, you will not lie when you are a witness,
value your father and your mother, also you will love the person near you as yourself' thing."
The young lad says to Him, "I observed all these from my youth. What do I still lack?"
Jesus was declaring to him, "If you want to be complete, go back; sell the things that are yours, give to poor people, you will have treasure in heavens, and come here; follow Me."
When the young lad heard the message, He went away sad. You see, he was a person who had many properties.
Jesus said to His students, "Amen, I tell you that it will be hard for a rich person as he goes into the empire of the heavens.
Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through an eye of a needle than for a rich person to go into the empire of God.
After His students heard this, they were being terribly impressed, saying, "Who is able to be rescued, then?"
When Jesus looked at them, He said to them, "Beside people this is impossible, but beside God everything is possible."
At that time, when Peter responded, he said to Him, "Look, we left everything and followed You. What will we have then?"

Jesus said to them, "Amen, I tell you that you, the people who followed Me, in the rebirth when the Son of the Person will be seated on a throne of His magnificence, you will also sit on twelve thrones judging the twelve family lines of Israel.

And everyone who left houses, or brothers, or sisters, or a father, or a mother, of a wife, or children, or fields on account of My Name will receive a hundred times that and inherit life that spans all time.
Many first people will be last, and last people first."
